definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale

sentences.english: Ben had it out with his roommate about coming back home so late and making a lot of noise.
sentences.chinese: 是有深夜遲歸引起一連串噪音，班因而與他起了口角。

sentences.english: When the patient shuts up, buccinator is very flabby, reason quarrel is flagging.
sentences.chinese: 患者閉嘴時，頰肌極爲鬆弛，故口角下垂。

sentences.english: Once again the U. S. and Chinafind themselves in a spat over the Chinese currency, the yuan.
sentences.chinese: 美中兩國再次因人民幣問題陷入口角之爭。

sentences.english: Must we let this become one of those places?
sentences.chinese: 難道我們就不能遠離那些狗咬狗式的口角戰爭嗎？

sentences.english: If this were a lone spat, it would hardly matter.
sentences.chinese: 如果這事兒只是一次口角，它很難說明什麼問題。

sentences.english: Often accompany have glossitis or quarrel is phlogistic.
sentences.chinese: 常常伴有舌炎或口角炎。

sentences.english: Press, who had a run-in with nonfamily Japanese bosses several years ago.
sentences.chinese: 普萊斯幾年前與非豐田家族日本高管之間發生過口角。

sentences.english: I have no reason to quarrel with him.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有跟他口角的理由。

sentences.english: To enhance immunity, prevent colds allergies, dermatitis, angular cheilitis .
sentences.chinese: 增強免疫力，預防感冒過敏，皮膚炎，口角炎。

sentences.english: Our discord was originated by a quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 一次口角導致了我們之間的不和。

sentences.english: A quarrel rose between the twin brothers.
sentences.chinese: 兩個孿生兄弟之間發生了口角。

sentences.english: We all believe it no good quarrelling over such trifles.
sentences.chinese: 咱們都以爲位這類區區小事口角沒有好處。

sentences.english: Then, seemingly on the spur of the moment, Morty started a squabble.
sentences.chinese: 後來，似乎一時衝動，莫迪和我發生口角。
她和她的朋友發生了口角。

sentences.english: She might call old friends to make peace over past quarrels.
sentences.chinese: 她也許給老友解釋夕日的口角，請求對方的諒解。

sentences.english: His success with Jane had resulted in the affray between him and John .
sentences.chinese: 他和珍的成功導致他和約翰間的口角。

definition: to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb
to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
to fight together/to come to blows
to mediate in a quarrel/to intervene in a dispute and try to calm things down
neither giving way to the other
to fight/to scuffle/to come to blows/CL:場|场[chang2]
